strings: <se_low>Do not be deceived by my size! I can give you some jolly sound advice when it comes to fighting. Come to see me once in a while. I have plenty of wisdom to impart to you!

<se_low>Aha! You've finally realised that a king might be able to teach you a thing or two about battle!
I have plenty of wisdom to impart to you!

<se_low>I am here to impart my battle wisdom to you.
AND I'VE BEEN HERE ALL ALONG!
What on earth has kept you from talking to me about this before!?

<se_low>Your experience in battle is still sadly lacking!
If you refuse to roll your sleeves up and get into
a fray once in a while, what use is it me giving
you advice!?

<se_low>I suppose I could impart some of my invaluable combat know-how to you before long. Engage in
a few more battles, and I shall enlighten you.
<se_low>Well, here we are. Ho-hum. There's little point in discussing strategy at this juncture! Just believe in yourself and fight!
<se_low>Good gracious! Do you realise you've now fought more than a thousand battles!? Well done you! There's no reward, I'm afraid, but a little praise never goes amiss.

<se_low>How incredible! Do you realise that you've now
fled from battle more than a thousand times!?
Not exactly something to be proud of, but still rather astonishing!

<se_low>Well! You've managed to intimidate and scare
away more than a thousand monsters!
Quite an achievement! Perhaps I'll call you
‘The Ultimate Worrier’ from now on, hm?
<se_low>My stars! You've been wiped out over a hundred times! The Grim Reaper and I will be on first-name terms soon! ‘May I call you “Grim”, or do you prefer “The”!?’

<se_low>Our little adventure's not so little any more!
We've been travelling together for more than
a hundred hours, you know.

<se_low>We've been on our adventure now for more than 999 hours. That's about forty days, you know.
How extraordinary!

<se_low>You've reached the highest level, <hero>!
I never imagined I would see the day! Fabulous!
<se_low>Yangus has reached the highest level. I only hope that nitwit doesn't let it go to his head!

<se_low>Jessica has reached the highest level. Ah, how the
once spoilt little girl has grown! They're a delight
to hold<endash> Er, I mean, IT'S a delight to BEhold!
Yes, yes, that's right...

<se_low>It looks like Angelo has reached the highest level.
I was under the impression his skills were all skin deep. Most surprising!
<se_low>There's no shame in trying to intimidate the enemy. It's a perfectly acceptable strategy to employ. And a wise one at times, I might add.

<se_low>Don't be embarrassed about fleeing from battle or being completely wiped out every now and then. These things are not blemishes on your record,
you know!

<se_low>You deserve some kind of honorary title for defeating this Lord of the Dragovians with your bare hands! From now on, I shall call you
‘The Dragon Drubber’!
<se_low>The only thing Jessica is missing now is <INDEF_ART_SGL_I_NAME_1>. Kindly stop dilly-dallying and complete her new look before you make me hopping mad! ...Ha ha, I do amuse myself so!

<se_low>I say, I haven't enjoyed skinning a rabbit since
my hunting days in Trodain! Jessica looks
positively delicious!

<se_low>Well! Jessica seems to walk around in a heat wave!
I start to perspire every time I go near her!
No wonder she's so sparingly attired!
<se_low>I never imagined anyone could cook up so much in my alchemy pot! Your pot training is complete!
<se_low>Extraordinary! You've battled every single type of monster I know about! I'd say you have a bit of a monster fetish, hm!?

<se_low>Well! You're quite the connoisseur, aren't you!? 
I've never seen such an impressive range of items!
I don't believe there's a single item left for you
to acquire!

<se_low>What an extraordinary distance we've covered!
Enough to take us all the way to the moon
I should say!
<se_low>Have we really come all this way on our own two feet...or four, in some cases? Such a great distance, merely from wandering around the world!
<se_low>Distance-wise, we've completed an entire circumference of the globe! But we still have a long way to go. A true marathon runner must train for the long-haul!

<se_low>We've certainly covered a fair distance now!
You should enter the next Trodain Marathon.
I'm quite sure you would do rather well!
<se_low>Do you realise we've covered the equivalent distance of a full marathon!? Not all at once, of course!

<se_low>Phew! The ten mile mark! Who can tell how
many miles we will cover before our journey
comes to an end?
<se_low>Red has reached the highest level. Indeed, she is most noticeably more competent under my leadership than she was before she joined us. Hm?
<se_low>Well, contrary to my expectations, Morrie has reached the highest level. Someone has too much time on their hands, methinks!
<se_low>Well! WHO is the Lord of the Underworld now, hm? You knocked him well and truly off his perch there, didn't you? Marvellous! Simply marvellous!
<se_low>I shall be young Jessica's number one fan if she makes a go of it on the stage. Oh yes, I've always felt a strong desire to ‘support’ her!
<se_low>The only thing Jessica is missing now is <INDEF_ART_SGL_I_NAME_1>. Do stop dilly-dallying and complete her scholarly look. She has much to learn, and I, much to impart!
<se_low>Aah, Jessica's outfit reminds me of my courting days, when I first met the late Queen of Trodain... She was quite a catch, I'll have you know!
<se_low>You cut a dashing figure, I must say, <hero>. Not quite as handsome as yours truly in his heyday, but close. They called me the ‘dapperling of Trodain’, don't you know!

<se_low>Ah ha ha, oh dearie me, whatever do you look like, Yangus? Even more disreputable than usual,
I would say...if such a thing were possible!
<se_low>Yes, Angelo is blessed with a becoming appearance whatever he cares to don. But let us not forget from whence he hails, hm? The Abbey! A place of holy reverence!

<se_low>Dear Goddess, it's Dhoulmagus! He's here!
Men! To arms!
...Oh, I see. It's you, Morrie. Kindly refrain from wearing such confusing attire in future!
<se_low>Hm, a thief in pirate's attire? The phrase ‘six and two threes’ comes to mind. Not to mention ‘your money or your life!’
<se_low>Hm, I must say that Red in a Mandarin gown is a sight to behold. Very...comely. Yes, very comely indeed. Ah ha ha hah!
<se_low>Oooh, ever since this cursed monster affliction, my shoulders have been giving me terrible trouble. I'm as stiff as a board. But that's hardly relevant now!
<se_low>Battle-filled days can dry up a man's heart, you know. You mustn't neglect to give yourself some lubrication once in a while.
<se_low>It might not look like it now, but in my formative years I burned the midnight oil studying military strategy, you know! Yes, you can rely on me to see you through!
<se_low>My highly sophisticated battle tactics would be lost on you two. In words you might understand, pummel them! Ooh, and don't forget to heal yourselves once in a while!

<se_low>The fundamentals of battle are a mixture of physical attacks, magic attacks and healing.
You'd do well to remember that!
<se_low>Were it not for this debilitating curse, I would be leading you into battle myself and fighting by your side! Ah, what a terrible shame!

<se_low>I'm not worried about me. It's my darling Medea.
If I fail to return her to normal, my dear late wife will see to it that my afterlife is most unpleasant!
<se_low>It's all about spirit! Spirit is absolutely fundamental! Let your spirit be defeated, and a victory in battle is no victory at all!
<se_low>To be honest, a little more strength wouldn't go amiss. Otherwise you won't be able to make use of some of my more advanced tactics.
<se_low>What we really need is a master of magic! I used to be a formidable magician myself, you know. Yes, if only I were a couple of years younger! Pity!
<se_low>Well! I shall have to call you ‘The Three Snowmen’ from now on! Hm? Why!? That is for me to know, and you to work out for yourself!

<se_low>Item 30 in the Trodain Tome of Tactics<:>
‘Weapons before armour.’ So you see, given a choice, you should buy weapons first!

<se_low>I've had to revise my entire wardrobe since I underwent my unfortunate ‘transformation’.
I think beige rather suits me now, don't you?
<se_low>There's nothing quite like the joy of being able to thrash an opponent with a single blow when it would have taken you two blows before!
<se_low>How can I be expected to keep abreast of fashion as an exile from town life!? ‘King Trode à la mode’, they used to say! But my days in vogue are a thing of the past now.
<se_low>There's no shame in a bit of intimidation, you know! Eliminating a few of your enemies by scaring them off is a perfectly valid strategy!
<se_low>Do you know, that old ailment I had for such a long time has finally cleared up since I've undergone my ‘change’. Every cloud has a silver lining, I suppose.

<se_low>Ah, yes! We have the manpower now! Soon it will
be time for me to impart some of my more
elaborate strategic advice to you! Don't forget to
ask me about it!

<se_low>What if I wake up surrounded by bunny girls tomorrow morning? What on earth will I do!?
It's a most vexing concern.
<se_low>I suppose at this stage it rather goes without saying, but the world really is vast! Walking around like this certainly brings it home to one.
<se_low>The Trodain Tome of Tactics is my bible! I don't need to consult it in paper form any more. Every item of wisdom it contains is engraved in my mind!

<se_low>Now is the time to refine your skills in
preparation for grappling with Dhoulmagus!
The great battle is nigh!

<se_low>I may have been turned into a monster, but at
least I still have the freedom to move about.
I'm thankful for that. The others in my castle suffered a far worse fate.
<se_low>Well done! You've become markedly stronger. But I don't want to see your training slip after you've defeated Dhoulmagus! You can never be too good!
<se_low>Once we've dispatched Dhoulmagus, I shall call for a banquet of unprecedented proportions at the castle! We'll have ourselves a bally bellyful!

<se_low>All of you can buy new outfits whenever you want to, while I'm just a one-frock girl. As it were.
I hanker for a fine tweed or some crisp linens myself, you know.
<se_low>I considered establishing a casino in Trodain Castle at one time, you know. But there were some<...>concerns about public safety, so I had to abandon the idea.

<se_low>It's all too common to see people decide on a battle strategy and then refuse to waver from it.
But variety is the key! You must realise when to switch to a new strategy!

<se_low>We have come a considerable distance together
now, haven't we? Perhaps it would be wise to
revisit some of the places we have already been
to, once in a while.

<se_low>If you continue to grow in strength like this,
I shouldn't be surprised to see you make it as a professional pugilist in the not-too-distant future!
<se_low>I feel rather as if we have traversed the entire world! Is there anywhere we have not yet been!?

<se_low>The sea harbours less monsters than the land,
but occasionally disgorges some fearful beasts.
There is no room for unpreparedness.

<se_low>Wisdom has more than a slight bearing on the effectiveness of one's magic, you know.
Hm? Oh, I see you didn't know!
Well, learn from the master!
<se_low>Being raised in a royal household, I was exposed to little of the outside world. I had no idea it was so many times larger than Trodain!
<se_low>Now we have become the seasoned travellers we are, I submit that we need a theme song! Something catchy. Perhaps we could write it ourselves?
<se_low>.........I would rather not talk today. My ulcers are causing me some discomfort.
<se_low>I thought everything would return to normal if we could just defeat Dhoulmagus. Aaah... Things are never as simple as they first appear.

<se_low>That twerp Yangus will not desist from calling me ‘Grandad’! He knows full well I despise the name! And anyway, I still have my youthful looks,
do I not!?

<se_low>Recently, I've been speculating that perhaps there
is just no way to return me to my old...er, former<...>handsome appearance.

<se_low>I'm starting to feel rather disheartened by the continued failure to solve my predicament, but
you seem to be going from strength to strength.
<se_low>With my royal upbringing, I wanted for very little as a child. But to fly! I truly believed that was beyond even a king's reach.

<se_low>I cannot return to my castle as it is now.
No, we shall just have to see this through now.
<se_low>I have to confess I have no more advice to impart. From now on, you shall have to devise your own strategies for battle.

<se_low>Yes. Don't be so embroiled in everything I have taught you up to now that it hinders your own fighting style. Forget this battle chronicle!
Free your mind!
<se_low>When I finally manage to bid farewell to my outmoded ‘monster look’, I shall summon all the tailors in the world and hold the King Trode Fashion Extravaganza!
<se_low>I have taken pains not to reveal this little secret before, but I'm rather partial to chocolate crêpes, you know! Mmmm, yes... It's been far too long!

<se_low>Having been cursed like this, I am in a very
strong position to educate you about monsters!
They're not all bad, you know. Some are rather well-to-do, I tell you!

<se_low>Soon after we set off from Trodain and arrived
in Farebury, I was confident that everything
would be resolved before long. But that was some time ago now!
<se_low>With the benefit of hindsight, of course, we know Dhoulmagus was merely a pawn in a far grander scheme. It's really rather extraordinary.

<se_low>Well I've been a monster and I've been a bird!
But just for one day, I'd rather like to experience what it's like to be a pretty young girl!

<se_low>You've yet to experience a real battle, of course,
but you have at least started along the right lines.

<se_low>You have yet to experience a proper battle.
And I'm a little nervous, I must confess.
<se_low>Hm. You've certainly managed to be wiped out a fair few times. You might have more success holding back and adopting a more cautious attitude.

<se_low>Well! Intimidating your adversaries is one thing,
but if you keep doing it all the time, I'll start to wonder if you're all bark and no trousers!
<se_low>This is what happens when you push yourself to the limit in every battle. You end up having to flee from them all! You mustn't overstretch yourself.

<se_low>It seems you're fleeing from battle fairly often.
Not to worry, it's a strategy just like any other!
<se_low>Are you a man or a snail!? You have been dawdling about, haven't you!? Come along, now! Stop wasting time and get that crystal ball!

<se_low>By George! You've got rather strong, I see!
Get any more mountainously muscular, and
you'll have people abseiling off you!
<se_low>Sometimes it's just impossible to avoid being wiped out. Still, you should think carefully about how best to heal yourself so that you don't end up dead!

<se_low>Intimidation is a fine strategy. In its place!
If you don't fight at this stage, you'll be in a terrible pickle when you encounter tougher monsters later on.

<se_low>Item 27 of the Trodain Tome of Tactics states<:>
‘Victory is a dish best seasoned with medicinal herbs!’ Heed the tome! Buy more herbs!
<se_low>It is a fine thing to immerse yourself in combat, I'm sure. Most admirable! But don't forget the task at hand! The crystal ball, hm!?
<se_low>You appear to be making a bit of a meal out of all this. If your opponents seem too brawny for you, perhaps you should try exchanging your weapons?
<se_low>Oh dear! You aren't in possession of a single medicinal herb! I really think you ought to purchase at least one!
<se_low>Well, you certainly seem fond of your medicinal herbs! Most wise! Don't let anyone tell you otherwise!
<se_low>Yes, not at all bad. You seem to be fighting rather well. Using the ‘bat down any monsters who get in your way’ strategy, hm!?
<se_low>I couldn't say you're the greatest fighters I've ever seen, but I suppose you'll do. Keep going as you are, and no doubt you will improve.

<se_low>You're not having much luck intimidating monsters, are you? That's because you're still
rather weak. Moderate your use of that strategy until you're a little tougher.
<se_low>Not an outstanding performance, but good enough to pass, I suppose. Keep up the good work.

<se_low>You seem to be more seasoned travellers than I realised. You're proving to be most reliable.
Just what I expect from my retainers!
Very good.

<se_low>You are really rather accomplished in battle.
It just goes to show that it's not all about strength.
Yes! Strategy, you see! Just as I said!
<se_low>We're in a serious spot of bother here! Try to avoid getting into any battles, and just pray we can get safely back to a town.
<se_low>It's a fair distance back to town from the cave. I'm a little concerned that we may run into trouble.

<se_low>Well, now we've got the crystal ball, we should try to avoid battles as best we can on the return journey. It's most important to have a plan,
you know!

<se_low>Our mission was to acquire the crystal ball.
Now we have it, we should remain inconspicuous
on the way back to town. So avoid battles.
Yes, a splendid strategy!
<se_low><Cap><hero> seems somewhat vulnerable. Perhaps it would be wise to assign Yangus as the leader.
<se_low>Yangus seems somewhat vulnerable. Perhaps it would be wise to assign <hero> as the leader.
I didn't expect you to have so much trouble at this stage. All you need to do is deliver the crystal ball!

<se_low>Brassy bravery in the face of danger is a most valuable asset at times! There's no shame if you
are wiped out as a result from time to time.
<se_low>Intimidation is a fine strategy. In its place! If you don't fight at this stage, you'll be in a terrible pickle when you encounter tougher monsters later on.

<se_low>Item 27 of the Trodain Tome of Tactics states<:>
‘Victory is a dish best seasoned with medicinal herbs!’ Heed the tome! Buy more herbs!
<se_low>It is a fine thing to immerse yourself in combat, I'm sure. Most admirable! But don't forget the task at hand! The crystal ball, hm!?
<se_low>Hm... It seems you're struggling. If your opponents seem too brawny for you, perhaps you should try exchanging your weapons?
<se_low>Perhaps you should start getting used to building up a little tension. I do like to see what my retainers can produce when they really clench up.
<se_low>Not an outstanding performance, but good enough to pass, I suppose. Keep up the good work.
<se_low>The most important thing now is to resurrect <hero>. The problem is deciding whether we should carry on or go back.
<se_low>The most important thing now is to resurrect that nincompoop Yangus. The problem is deciding whether we should carry on or go back.
<se_low>Hmph! You have no misgivings when it comes to intimidating your opponents, then? Especially the weaker ones! Your cowardice is palpable!
<se_low>I know you face some life-threatening battles, and I'm not accusing you of using underhand tactics, but shame on you for turning tail so often!

<se_low>If this is to be the pace for our entire journey,
I fear I may be in my grave before we see its end. Onwards, I say!
<se_low>Do you realise how many times you've been wiped out!? Pull yourself together!

<se_low>By George! You've got rather strong, I see!
Get any more mountainously muscular,
and you'll have people abseiling off you!

<se_low>It looks like it may take some time to catch up
with Dhoulmagus at this rate. But never fear, determination will see us through!
It's one thing being wiped out in a heated battle, but quite another for the lot of you to die through careless distraction! More vigilance, I say!
<se_low>I was quite a comely catch in my younger years. I spent a good deal of time fleeing from over-excited young maidens, so I fully understand your tactics.
<se_low>You're not doing at all badly. If anything, I suppose you exhibit a slightly worrying reliance on intimidation tactics.

<se_low>If you want to scare your opponents off, you need
a keen eye for your respective strengths. You won't intimidate monsters who are stronger than you.
<se_low>I see you haven't been shying away from battle! Well, your experience will no doubt tell you that a little haste can be necessary once in a while. Hm?
<se_low>Well I wouldn't be able to single you out in a crowd, but I suppose your skills are good enough for a pass. Keep up the good work.

<se_low>Minimal effort, maximal results! Splendid!
I must congratulate myself on having such exceptional retainers!

<se_low>Good, good! A most encouraging pace indeed!
Carry on at this tempo, and we shall soon hem
in the accursed Dhoulmagus!
<se_low>There's a pearl of wisdom just inside the cover of the Trodain Tome of Tactics<:> ‘Two's company...so long as one of them isn't dead...in which case you have a problem!’ Hm!?

<se_low>I suppose there is some virtue in intimidating
your foes. I understand that you'd like to avoid unnecessary loss of life, but I'm finding it rather dull!

<se_low>You seem to be fleeing from battle rather frequently. Do it again, and I shall start calling
you a flea!
<se_low><Cap><hero> seems to be perishing at the drop of a hat! We need a full complement of men if our tactics are to work!

<se_low>That baboon Yangus can't even seem to stay alive! I must admit, I often wish he was dead myself,
but this is most inconvenient!
<se_low>Item 18 in the Trodain Tome of Tactics states that the prudent do not hoard gold! A spending spree is long overdue!
<se_low>Throw caution to the wind! Try battling some feisty foes! You never know, you might enjoy it!

<se_low>‘Saving too much money is the harbinger of
an unhappy heart.’ I quote the wise words of
Mr. Garner, a regular contributor to the
Trodain Gazette.
<se_low>Only an amateur scurries back to town every time they're poisoned! Royal retainers should know to carry antidotal herbs!
<se_low>As we venture further from the relative serenity of Trodain Castle, we seem to be encountering more menacing monsters. Stay alert!

<se_low>Wonderful! I see you're not too haughty to run away once in a while. And not too timorous to stand and fight when the time is right!
A fine balance!

<se_low>Why are you saving up so many seeds instead
of using them, hm!? Are you expecting trouble?
Do you think I'm going to need stiffening up
or something!?

<se_low>Your battling thus far has been top notch!
Carry on like this, and we shall have Dhoulmagus in the bag!

<se_low>Your performance in battle has been average on the whole. But an average existence is the mark
of true happiness! So said many a former king
of Trodain.

<se_low>Those hair-raising cries you use to intimidate monsters are most effective. Even on me!
Not that I have much hair to raise.
Although I am a monster, I suppose.

<se_low>I see you've been having a go at raising your tension, but I can't say there's much evidence
of it doing any good. More experimentation!
<se_low>The deftness with which you utilise tension is most exhilarating! Just the sort of super-charged combat I like to see!

<se_low>Oh, the squander! You're letting all that tension
go to waste! A lamentable situation if ever there
was one.
<se_low>Item 18 in the Trodain Tome of Tactics states that the prudent do not hoard gold! A spending spree is long overdue!

<se_low>Dhoulmagus could be anywhere by now!
Your lazy pottering around is making me
more and more uneasy.
<se_low>True, the opening lines of the Trodain Tome of Tactics submit that a warrior should not be fearful of death. But one must know when to take the Tome with a pinch of salt!

<se_low>Never afraid to show an untimely foe a clean
pair of heels, hm!? Well at least they're clean.
But I expect my retainers to show a bit more grit!
<se_low>That young lady, Jessica, has a personality I simply cannot fathom. But anyway...stop fleeing and stand your ground more!
<se_low>Just thinking about the next buxom bellow Jessica will use to intimidate her antagonists gives me a mild panic attack!
<se_low>I must say, I think you're a little overly laid-back. Perhaps you should consider picking up the pace, hm!?

<se_low>With an entourage of your calibre, no monster shall go unsubdued! Ah, what a delightful sense
of superiority!

<se_low>The Trodain Tome of Tactics, item 2<:>
‘More haste, less speed! Devote enough time
to preparations.’
<se_low>The monsters we are encountering are becoming noticeably stronger. No doubt a consequence of Dhoulmagus's evil influence.

<se_low>Yes, yes, that's right! Come to the master in
times of trouble! I do like a retainer who values
my advice.
<se_low>A peerless performance! It takes a truly great king's retainer to make such short work of a journey as challenging as ours!
<se_low>When I was a young boy, it was considered somewhat hep to train hard and improve one's skills. ...How the times do change, hm?

<se_low>When your ranks are low, there are times when fleeing is the only sensible course of action.
Let's try to avoid incurring any more casualties
of war, shall we?
<se_low>You perhaps run from battle a little too often. Still, I suppose it's preferable to seeing you all annihilated because you've bitten off more than you can chew.

<se_low>Your quiet saving has accumulated you a small fortune. Why don't you spend it all at once!?
You could buy something fit for a king...perhaps?
<se_low>Is this a strategy you've devised? To wander around at such a leisurely pace and wait for Dhoulmagus to die of old age? I may well go first, you know!

<se_low>I understand you may be apprehensive, touring
a new land like this, but you're perfectly well prepared! Throw caution to the wind!
Let yourself go!

<se_low>Behind this ugly, cursed exterior, my youthful
looks are ticking away, you know! I need to regain my handsome visage as quickly as possible!
Speed things up!

There are many new monsters around here.
A fact you are no doubt well aware of, the
number of times you've been wiped out!
Well, now it's time to stop dying and start trying!
<se_low>After completing a battle, you must pay heed to your HP and heal if necessary, especially if you were caught off guard. Understood!?

<se_low>Item 4 of the Trodain Tome of Tactics! ‘A battle fled in the knowledge that victory is certain,
is a battle well fought!’ A fine adage indeed!
<se_low>Your healing abilities are abysmal! When one of the party perishes in battle, the time for heroics is over! A wise warrior would seek out a church.
<se_low>This church resurrection service is all very well, but death takes its toll on the body, not to mention the purse. It is best avoided, I assure you!

<se_low>Travelling between towns on foot as we do,
we cannot avoid monsters. Startling them into submission and preserving strength is very
wise indeed.
<se_low>You are quite the fleeing flea! To be perfectly honest, you should be ashamed of yourself!

<se_low>Dashing off in the face of danger is one matter,
but doing the same when it is quite safe tarnishes
a soldier's honour!
<se_low>Tiddly-om-pom-pom, Dhoulmagus shall be gone! ♪ It's taking so long to make any progress, I've had to invent a song to avoid forgetting the fiend's name!
<se_low>Training is always commendable. But not to the extent that you die from it!
<se_low>Intimidation is one hand you can play when facing an enemy clearly weaker than yourself. You scare them, you see. BAH! Just like that!
<se_low>Don't worry about dying in battle! A soldier who has never been wiped out in combat knows only the fear of the battle[-]field, and none of its excitement!
<se_low>I have no bones to pick with you regarding your combat abilities, but what about the alchemy pot, hm!? I didn't mend it for fun!
<se_low>Ne'er a battle fled, nor a victory missed! You are a sensation! A prodigy of the battlefield! These are the seeds of a legend, I tell you!
<se_low>Your record at scaring off the enemy is nothing short of pitiful! You must pay more attention to who you try to intimidate.

<se_low>The Trodain Tome of Tactics is quite clear on this. Item 31<:> ‘Before purchasing a new weapon, consider what the next town might have to offer.’
Wise words, wise words...

<se_low>Squelch is one way to heal someone of poison,
but wise adventurers conserve their precious
MP and take pains to carry antidotal herbs.
